dragoniteReminder:
> **_Notice:_**
> All "Pokémon" related commands will be removed in the future in favor of the stand-alone bot [Dragonite](<https://top.gg/bot/931264626614763530>).
> [Dragonite](<https://top.gg/bot/931264626614763530>) features auto-complete for all search queries and gives more up-to-date and better parsed data than Skyra.
> [Dragonite](<https://top.gg/bot/931264626614763530>) is also maintained by the same developers as Skyra so you will get all the same premium quality that you're used to already.
abilityDescription: Gets data for any given Pokémon ability using my Pokémon dataset.

abilityExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches.
explainedUsage: The ability for which you want to find data

abilityQueryFail:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure `{{ability}}` is actually an ability in Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
flavorsDescription: Gets the dex entries across various games for a Pokémon.

flavorsExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches.
You can provide a flag of `--shiny` to get the shiny sprite.
And a flag of `--back` to get the back sprite (i.e. the sprite you see when you send out this Pokémon)
explainedUsage: The Pokémon for which you want to get flavour texts
Whether the data should show the shiny sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--back`.
Whether the data should show the back sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--shiny`.

flavorsQueryFail:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure `{{pokemon}}` is actually a Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
flavorNoFlavors:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but no flavor text was available for `{{pokemon}}`.

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
itemDescription: Gets data for any given Pokémon item using my Pokémon dataset.

itemExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches.
explainedUsage: The item for which you want to find data

itemQueryFail:
I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure `{{item}}` is actually a item in Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
learnDescription: Retrieves whether a given Pokémon can learn one or more given moves using my Pokémon dataset.

learnExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches. Moves split on every `, ` (comma space) and you can provide as many moves as you wish.
You can provide a flag of `--shiny` to get the shiny sprite.
And a flag of `--back` to get the back sprite (i.e. the sprite you see when you send out this Pokémon)
explainedUsage: The generation for which to check the data
The Pokémon whose learnset you want to check
The moves you want to check for, separated by commas
Whether the data should show the shiny sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--back`.
Whether the data should show the back sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--shiny`.

learnMethodTypes.virtualTransferMoves: by transfering from virtual console games
learnMethodTypes.tmMoves: by using a technical machine or technical record

learnInvalidGeneration:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but {{generation}} is not a supported Pokémon Generation.

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
learnQueryFailed:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure you `{{pokemon, toTitleCase}}` is actually a Pokémon and {{moves, andList}} are actually moves?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
learnCannotLearn:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Looks like {{pokemon, toTitleCase}} cannot learn {{moves, orList}}
learnTitle: Learnset data for {{pokemon, toTitleCase}} in generation {{generation}}
moveDescription: Gets data for any given Pokémon move using my Pokémon dataset

moveExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches.
explainedUsage: The move for which you want to find data
moveExtended.reminder:
Z-Move power may be shown for Generation 8 moves because it is calculated with a conversion table.
If Pokémon ever returns Z-Moves to the game this would be their theoretical power, however as it stands
Z-Moves are **NOT** in Generation 8.

moveQueryFail:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure `{{move}}` is actually a move in Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
pokedexDescription: Gets data for any given Pokémon using my Pokémon dataset.

pokedexExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Uses a fuzzy search to also match against near-matches.
You can provide a flag of `--shiny` to get the shiny sprite.
And a flag of `--back` to get the back sprite (i.e. the sprite you see when you send out this Pokémon)
explainedUsage: The Pokémon for which you want to find data
Whether the data should show the shiny sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--back`.
Whether the data should show the back sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--shiny`.
pokedexExtended.reminder:
If there are any "Other forme(s)" on the optional fourth page, those can be requested as well.
Cosmetic Formes on that page list purely cosmetic changes and these do not have seperate entries in the Pokédex.

pokedexQueryFail:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure `{{pokemon}}` is actually a Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
spriteDescription: Gives you the sprite of a Pokémon.

spriteExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Useful if you want to check if the name of a Pokémon that you're remembering is actually that Pokémon.
You can provide a flag of `--shiny` to get the shiny sprite.
And a flag of `--back` to get the back sprite (i.e. the sprite you see when you send out this Pokémon)
explainedUsage: The Pokémon for which you want to get the sprite
Whether the data should show the shiny sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--back`.
Whether the data should show the back sprite of the Pokémon or not. Can be combined with `--shiny`.

typeDescription: Gives the type matchups for one or two Pokémon types

typeExtended.extendedHelp:
$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)

Types have to be exact matches to pokemon types (upper/lowercase can be ignored)

typeTooManyTypes:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but you can get the matchup for at most 2 types.

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
typeNotAType:
{{REDCROSS}} {{type}} is not a valid Pokémon type.

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
typeQueryFail:
{{REDCROSS}} I am sorry, but that query failed. Are you sure {{types, andList}} are actually types in Pokémon?

$t(commands/pokemon:dragoniteReminder)
